a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:42): using 100% makes the Table width dependent on the parent container's
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:42): so, if you don't want the TD shrinking to a point the child Divs will bleed out, then you do have to provided a fixed minimum
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:46): table-layout: fixed; works on the Table and then on the 1st TR of, the the 2nd TD give it a fixed figure
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:46): the % unit is what makes the TD shrink

a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:49): Pyru:  the Divs do not have a width set, but since they're all in a TD, the longest-word Div will dictate the Div's width, and while the TD shrinks, the Div can't due to lack of white-space to wrap chars :)
